clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Methylphenidate in Children and Adolescents in France
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Methylphenidate in Children and Adolescents in France

brief_summary.textblock: The use of methylphenidate in children and adolescents in France from 2010 to 2015

detailed_description.textblock: To describe the use of methylphenidate in children and adolescents in France from 2010 to 2015

primary_outcome.description: Describe of the use of methylphenidate over time to determine the impact of regulatory information of appropriate prescription conditions of use in September 2012

secondary_outcome.measure: Describe methylphenidate patterns of use over time
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmaceutical specialties (immediate or extended release forms) prescribed by type of delivery: initial or renewals. Profile of prescribers: hospital or private practice (general practitioners, specialists) depending on type of prescription (initial or renewal); geographical distribution of the prescribers Profile of patients: sex, average age and age classes (0-23 months, 2-5 years, 6-11 years, 12-17 years), socioeconomic status, long-lasting diseases status for psychosis, severe personality disorder, mental retardation. Pattern of methylphenidate use: duration of treatment, prolonged use, interruption of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Co-prescription of methylphenidate and non-psychostimulant psychotropic drugs

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- children and adolescents (0-17 years)
- registered in the French Health Insurance Database from 2012-2015
